content:
• Friday, April 5, 2019
  • EARS

    Auris Medical -3.2% as holder files 10M-share prospectus

    • Auris Medical Holding (NASDAQ:EARS) is 3.2% lower after hours as a holder files to offer up to 10M shares.
    • LPC Capital Fund may sell up to that amount from time to time, with common shares that may be issued to LPC pursuant to a purchase agreement.
    • Auris isn't selling any securities and won't receive any proceeds; however it may get proceeds of up to $8.99M from issuing shares to LPC under the purchase agreement.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:06 PM | 1 Comment

  • BPT, CPG, NPTN and CHRS among notable after hour movers

    • Top Gainers: CHRS +25.9%. NPTN +4.6%. EVGN +2.9%. UXIN +1.5%. LAC +1.3%.
    • Top Losers: SCHN -3.2%. BPT -2.8%. SPR -2.4%. HXL -2.4%. CPG -2.3%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:43 PM
  • SPR

    Spirit Aerosystems says will maintain 737 deliveries at current rate

    • Spirit AeroSystems (NYSE:SPR) -3% after-hours following Boeing's announcement that it will temporarily adjust its 737 production from 52 to 42 airplanes per month starting in mid-April.
    • SPR follows with its own statement that it will maintain its 737 deliveries to Boeing at the current rate of 52 shipsets per month, as it seeks to minimize the disruption to its operations and supply chain.
    • SPR says it will store accumulated 737 MAX shipsets at its facilities, which will be transferred to Boeing to support their production plan.
    • Among other Boeing suppliers, TGI -4.1%, HXL -2.4%, UTX -1.5%, ATRO -1% after-hours.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:28 PM | 11 Comments
  • TTNP

    Titan Pharma files for $50M mixed shelf; shares down 3% after hours

    • Titan Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:TTNP) has filed a prospectus for a $50M mixed shelf offering. Shares are off 3% after hours.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:02 PM | 1 Comment
  • UBOT

    Weekly ETF Gainers / Losers (04/05/19)

    • Top gainers: UBOT +18.1%. SOXL +18.0%. MEXX +17.6%. OILU +16.1%. UWT +16.1% .
    • Top losers: SOXS -16.1%. OILD -14.7%. DWT -14.6%. WDRW -14.4%. WTID -14.1%.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:34 PM
  • RWLK

    ReWalk closes $4.25M capital raise

    • ReWalk Robotics (NASDAQ:RWLK) has closed its direct offering of ~817K ordinary shares at $5.2025 per share, yielding gross proceeds of ~$4.25M.
    • The company also issued 5 1/2-year warrants to purchase up to ~408K shares at $5.14.
    • The stock is up a fraction after hours.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:23 PM | 2 Comments
  • CHRS

    Coherus sees up to $38M in Q1 Udenyca sales; shares up 5% after hours

    • On a preliminary basis, Coherus BioSciences (NASDAQ:CHRS) expects Q1 sales of Neulasta biosimilar UDENYCA (pegfilgrastim-cbqv) to be $36M - 38M, well above consensus of $2.8M.
    • The company will provide additional details during its Q1 conference call on May 9.
    • The European Commission approved the product in September 2018 followed by the FDA in November 2018.
    • Shares are up 5% after hours.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:15 PM | 9 Comments
  • PBR

    Engie-led group to buy Petrobras' TAG gas pipeline unit for $9B - Bloomberg

    • Petrobras (PBR +2.1%) agrees to sell its TAG natural gas pipeline network to a consortium led by France’s Engie (OTCPK:ENGIY) for $8.6B, Bloomberg reports.
    • The Engie consortium, which also includes Canada’s Caisse de Dépôt e Placement du Québec, beat out two competing groups led by Itausa Investimentos Itau and EIG Global Energy Partners with Mubadala Investment, according to the report.
    • Reuters reported earlier this week that PBR had accepted final bids for TAG, which likely will be the company's largest divestiture in its asset sales program.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:04 PM | 3 Comments
  • TGI

    Triumph Group hits 11-month high on strategic alternatives news

    • Triumph Group (TGI +13.1%) soars to 11-month highs after saying it will explore strategic alternatives for its Aerospace Structures unit and has engaged Citigroup as a financial advisor for its strategic alternatives review process.
    • The analyst team at Canaccord sees the news as a clear positive, although it is early to determine the outcome of the strategic review.
    • The firm notes the company also announced it has reached an agreement with IAI to transition all of the G280 wing production to IAI, also a net positive, as the G280 wing program was facing increasing uncertainty.
    • While Canaccord remains cautious on the stock, citing limited visibility on exactly how much value the actions can create, it thinks the moves are positive for a stock trading at just ~11x its $1.80 in guidance for FY 2019 EPS.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:57 PM

  • Microcaps dominate tech movers

    • Gainers: Aehr Test Systems (NASDAQ:AEHR) +17%. JMU Limited (NASDAQ:JMU) +15%. Communications Systems (NASDAQ:JCS) +12%. Summit Wireless Technologies (NASDAQ:WISA) +10%. One Stop Systems (NASDAQ:OSS) +9%.
    • Losers: Phunware (NASDAQ:PHUN) -7%. Spark Networks SE (NYSEMKT:LOV) -6%. Bel Fuse (NASDAQ:BELFB) -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:54 PM

  • Extraction Oil & Gas and Forum Energy Technologies among Energy/Materials gainers; Foresight Energy and Pacific Ethanol among losers

    • Gainers: Extraction Oil & Gas (NASDAQ:XOG) +9%. Forum Energy Technologies (NYSE:FET) +9%. Mexco Energy (NYSEMKT:MXC) +9%. Denbury Resources (NYSE:DNR) +8%. Unit (NYSE:UNT) +8%.
    • Losers: Foresight Energy (NYSE:FELP) -8%. Pacific Ethanol (NASDAQ:PEIX) -7%. Americas Silver (NYSEMKT:USAS) -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:02 PM
  • CMG

    Skittish trading on Chipotle after CDC warns on unrelated E. coli cases

    • Chipotle (CMG) turns lower after being in positive territory for most of the session after the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention warns on an E. coli outbreak in five states.
    • By all appearances, at least a few traders (human or algo) are skittish on CMG even after the CDC stated that no food item, grocery store or restaurant chain has not been identified as the source of infections.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:30 PM | 9 Comments
  • GHSI

    Guardion Health prices downsized IPO at $4

    • Guardion Health Sciences (NASDAQ:GHSI) has priced its initial public offering (IPO) of 1.25M common shares at $4 per share. Underwriters over-allotment is an additional 187.5K shares.
    • Gross proceeds should be $5M, half the size of its plan in November 2018.
    • Trading should commence today.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:19 PM
  • LGCY

    Legacy Reserves gets board nominations from Baines Creek

    • Legacy Reserves (LGCY +4.5%) says activist investor Baines Creek Partners nominated three director candidates to stand for election at the company's annual shareholders meeting.
    • LGCY says it has met several times with the hedge fund and is open to continued engagement in "working toward reaching an outcome that is in the best interest of all our stakeholders."
    • Baines Creek owns 23.5% of LGCY's outstanding stock.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:05 PM | 64 Comments

  • CNFinance Holdings leads financial gainers; Atlas Financial and China Internet Nationwide Financial Services among losers

    • Gainers: CNFinance Holdings (NYSE:CNF) +14%. HomeStreet (NASDAQ:HMST) +9%. Jupai Holdings (NYSE:JP) +9%. PPDAI Group (NYSE:PPDF) +6%. eHealth (NASDAQ:EHTH) +6%.
    • Losers: Yangtze River Port and Logistics (NASDAQ:YRIV) -14%. Atlas Financial Holdings (NASDAQ:AFH) -14%. China Internet Nationwide Financial Services (NASDAQ:CIFS) -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:04 PM

  • Triumph Group leads industrial gainers; Jason Industries and Concrete Pumping in losers

    • Gainers: Triumph Group (NYSE:TGI) +11%. Euro Tech Holdings (NASDAQ:CLWT) +8%. CVD Equipment (NASDAQ:CVV) +7%. Century Communities (NYSE:CCS) +7%. Fuel Tech (NASDAQ:FTEK) +6%.
    • Losers: Jason Industries (NASDAQ:JASN) -8%. Concrete Pumping (NASDAQ:BBCP) -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:01 PM | 1 Comment
  • STNE

    Citi cuts StoneCo as fundamentals priced in

    • Stoneco (STNE -3.5%) fell as much as 5.2% after Citi analyst Felipe Salomao trimmed his rating on the stock to neutral a its current valuation "prices in most of the positive fundamentals for the next quarters," he writes.
    • YTD, StoneCo has rallied 96%.
    • Though Salomao cut his adjusted EPS estimate for 2019, he boosted them for 2020 and 2021.
    • He sees StoneCo continuing to "offset competitive pressure with growth towards smaller clients."
    • The Brazilian fintech firm counts Warren Buffet's Berkshire Hathaway and Jack Ma's Ant Financial among its stockholders.
    • Analyst ratings.
    • Previously: StoneCo -1.7% after follow-on offering prices (April 3)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:51 PM | 46 Comments
  • GMVHF

    Online brands lift GVC Holdings

    • GVC Holdings (OTCPK:GMVHF) says it recorded online growth of 17% in Q1 on a proforma basis. Total revenue was up 8% during the quarter.
    • Trading update: "We continue to see good volume growth across all major online brands and territories and we remain very confident of achieving our target of double-digit online NGR growth. The impact of soft gross win margins in Italy and the UK was offset by improved margins in other territories, demonstrating the benefit of both geographic and product diversification across the Group. In UK Retail and European Retail, improved sports wagering growth helped offset softer sports gross win margins. New B2 machines stakes restrictions were implemented in the UK on 1 April 2019 and we expect it to be several weeks before we can start to assess the impact. At this early stage of the year, the Board is confident of delivering EBITDA and operating profit in-line with expectations."
    • Shares of GVC finished 0.86% higher today in London trading.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:50 PM

  • Microcaps mostly among midday movers

    • Gainers: Vital Therapies (NASDAQ:VTL) +199%. JMU Limited (NASDAQ:JMU) +24%. Aehr Test Systems (NASDAQ:AEHR) +22%. GEE Group (NYSEMKT:JOB) +19%. ChinaNet Online Holdings (NASDAQ:CNET) +15%. RumbleON (NASDAQ:RMBL) +15%. Hancock Jaffe Laboratories (NASDAQ:HJLI) +14%. CNFinance Holdings (NYSE:CNF) +13%. Replimune Group (NASDAQ:REPL) +12%. Zynerba Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ZYNE) +13%.

Merrimack Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:MACK) -15%. Yangtze River Port and Logistics (NASDAQ:YRIV) -14%. Outlook Therapeutics (NASDAQ:OTLK) -14%. Atlas Financial Holdings (NASDAQ:AFH) -14%. Nxt-ID (NASDAQ:NXTD) -9%. Sunlands Online Education Group (NYSE:STG) -8%.

  • Coffee Holding and Fuwei Films among consumer gainers; The Boston Beer Company in loser

    • Gainers: Fuwei Films (NASDAQ:FFHL) +14%. IT Tech Packaging (NYSEMKT:ITP) +7%. Coffee Holding (NASDAQ:JVA) +7%. Pingtan Marine Enterprise (NASDAQ:PME) +5%.
    • Losers: The Boston Beer Company (NYSE:SAM) -6%.

  • SCVL

    Shoe Carnival rides Sidoti upgrade higher

    • Shoe Carnival (NASDAQ:SCVL) is up 2.79% after Sidoti upgrades the retailer to a Buy rating from Neutral.
    • The firm's price target of $42 on SCVL reps +25% upside potential and is at a level which the stock hasn't traded at since last September.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:38 AM
  • CNSL

    Consolidated Comms opens gigabit Internet for rural New Yorkers

    • Consolidated Communications (CNSL +2.1%) has launched gigabit Internet service to its rural New York service areas.
    • It's tapping new fiber-to-the-premises technology to offer the high speeds in its state footprint.
    • The company's benefiting from a grant from the New NY Broadband Program; support has helped Consolidated extend fiber-based broadband to more than 10,000 business/residential locations, along with 5,000 locations outside the program.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:30 AM | 1 Comment

  • WSJ: Apple Music passes Spotify in U.S. paying subscribers

    • In a major growth milestone, Apple Music (AAPL +0.3%) has passed Spotify (SPOT +1.7%) in U.S. subscribers, in what could be a precursor to catching up around the world, The Wall Street Journal reports.
    • While neither company offers regional breakdowns, Apple's offering has surpassed 28M U.S. subs (paying users only) as of February, to Spotify's 26M, according to the report. That's the result of growing at 2.6%-3% monthly, vs. Spotify's 1.5%-2%.
    • If including nonpaying listeners to the ad-supported tier, Spotify has more U.S. users.
    • On a worldwide basis, Spotify still has a large lead, with 207M active users and 96M of those either paying subs or in a trial leading to a subscription, while Apple Music has more than 50M paying subs.
    • Apple has leveraged its hardware base to draw users to service like Music; it has a base of about 101M active iPhones in the U.S.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:25 AM | 74 Comments
  • AEHR

    Aehr Test Systems jumps 23% post Q3 results

    • Aehr Test Systems (AEHR +23.2%) reported Q3 net sales decline of 57.2% Y/Y to $3.16M, due to many of customers’ capacity ramps pushed into Q4 and into next fiscal year that begins June 1, 2019.
    • Q3 Gross margin declined by 4,513 bps to 8.6%.
    • Loss from operations expanded to $3.12M, compared to income of $307k last year.
    • SG&A expenses were $1.85M (+1.2% Y/Y); and R&D $931k (-10.5% Y/Y).
    • Inventories were at $9.19M as of February 28, 2019, compared to $9.98M last quarter.
    • Backlog as of February 28, 2019 was $6.9M, up sequentially from $4.3M as of November 30, 2018. With the additional order subsequent to quarter end, effective backlog is over $10M.
    • Company also announced a $2.1M follow-on order from its lead customer for a FOX-XP Wafer Level Test and Burn-in System for high volume production of silicon photonics devices to meet additional capacity forecast for this customer within the next six months.
    • Previously: Aehr Test Systems beats by $0.01, misses on revenue (April 4)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:04 AM

  • TrovaGene leads healthcare gainers; Merrimack Pharmaceuticals and Syros Pharmaceuticals among losers

    • Gainers: TrovaGene (NASDAQ:TROV) +16%. Hancock Jaffe Laboratories (NASDAQ:HJLI) +11%. Zynerba Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ZYNE) +9%. Corbus Pharmaceuticals Holdings (NASDAQ:CRBP) +8%. Evogene (NASDAQ:EVGN) +6%.
    • Losers: LivaNova (NASDAQ:LIVN) -26%. Syros Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:SYRS) -23%. AquaBounty Technologies (NASDAQ:AQB) -20%. Outlook Therapeutics (NASDAQ:OTLK) -11%. Merrimack Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:MACK) -11%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:01 AM | 2 Comments
  • WIFI

    Boingo Wireless +1.9% as Northland reiterates bullish take

    • Boingo Wireless (WIFI +1.9%) is higher after Northland Capital reiterated its Outperform rating, pointing to "highly scalable" and predictable revenue in the near term.
    • In the longer term, Boingo could end up as an attractive acquisition candidate, the firm says.
    • It's got a $35 price target, implying 41% upside.
    • Shares are up 18.4% YTD; they're down 25.2% over the past six months.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:57 AM
  • FE

    FirstEnergy +3% as Morgan Stanley sees buying opportunity

    • FirstEnergy (FE +2.8%) starts sharply higher, as Morgan Stanley says the stock is a buying opportunity following yesterday's 4% plunge in the wake of a court decision regarding its bankrupt FirstEnergy Solutions subsidiary.
    • A bankruptcy judge ruled FE would not be released from potential damages for environmental liabilities that occurred while the company owned power plants that are expected to be taken over by FirstEnergy Solutions.
    • But Stanley sees minimal impact from the court ruling and says the ~$900M reduction in FE's market cap significantly exceeds the likely liability as a result of the decision.
    • The firm maintains its Overweight rating, citing FE's "low-risk and highly achievable" above-average 6%-8% earnings growth through 2021 with "many years of strong transmission growth ahead."
     
     
     
     
    | 10:42 AM
  • LYFT

    Lyft shorts to be taught expensive lesson - Citron

    • Lyft (NASDAQ:LYFT) is "The Amateur Short," tweets Andrew Left. "Shorting disruptive companies that dominate a megatrend simply because they lose money is a sure way to go broke. We have learned the hard way."
    • Shares are up 4.6% today to $75.34.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:38 AM | 84 Comments
  • CJREF

    Corus +5.7% after TV ad revenues pace Q2 beat

    • Corus Entertainment (OTCPK:CJREF) is up 5.7% after topping consensus with its fiscal Q2 results, boosted by solid strength in TV advertising.
    • Ad revenues for TV jumped 11% for the quarter, more than offsetting subscriber revenues that dipped 1%. Profit in the TV segment rose 10% both for the quarter and year-to-date.
    • Growth in TV was mitigated by declines in the radio segment, where profit margin dropped to 16% from 21%.
    • Adjusted attributable net income was C$15.7M.
    • "The benefits of our ongoing progress in advanced advertising and data initiatives, our client centric approach and robust advertising demand are reflected in these positive results, partially offset by softness in our Radio segment and timing-related variability in our content business," says CEO Doug Murphy.
    • Free cash flow ticked up to C$83.9M from C$82.1M
    • Revenue breakout: Television, C$353.5M (up 5.1%); Radio, C$30.6M (down 7.8%).
    • Profit by segment: Television, C$113.7M (up 9.7%); Radio, C$4.96M (down 28%).
    • Earnings call slides
    • Press release
     
     
     
     
    | 10:38 AM | 11 Comments
  • LIVN

    LivaNova down 28% on preliminary Q1 miss

    • LivaNova (LIVN -28%) slumps on almost double normal volume in early trade following its release of preliminary Q1 results that showed no yoy growth due to unexpected weakness in the U.S.
    • Total sales should be $250.5M, only $0.1M above the results from a year ago. Consensus view was $264.6M.
    • The company says that it is reviewing its 2019 guidance and will update investors during its Q1 conference call on May 1.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:51 AM
  • PGNX

    Velan Capital reports 6% stake in Progenics Pharma

    • Institutional shop Velan Capital discloses a 6% stake of 5.1M shares in Progenics Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:PGNX).
    • Shares are up 2% premarket on light volume.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:26 AM | 14 Comments
  • AMX

    América Móvil +2.1% as JPMorgan sees end of regulatory 'worst'

    • America Movil (NYSE:AMX) is up 2.1% premarket after an upgrade to Overweight at JPMorgan, from Neutral.
    • The "worst is over" in Mexico for the company, analyst Andre Baggio writes, after a regulatory campaign to blunt the company's dominance during which America Movil has shown it can "adapt and cope." And with acquisitions like Nextel Brazil, the company should continue to gain share in Brazil, he says. (h/t Bloomberg)
    • He's raised his price target to $17 from $16, implying 15.5% upside.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:22 AM

  • Constellation CEO talks up Canopy Growth potential

    • Constellation Brands (NYSE:STZ) CEO Bill Newlands thinks Canopy Growth (NYSE:CGC) could churn up more than $1B in revenue by the end of the fiscal year.
    • "If you look at Canada alone, Canada is on a run rate of $5 [billion] to $6 billion in sales, and Canopy is the leading player in that market," Newlands tells CNBC.
    • "Then you add in new form factors later this year in things like beverage and other edibles, we think the sky’s the limit," he adds.
    • Constellation holds a 38% stake in Canopy.
    • Canopy is up 1.02% in premarket action, while Constellation is down 0.76% with a DB downgrade weighing.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:06 AM | 50 Comments
  • TROV

    Trovagene up 18% on capital raise

    • Trovagene (NASDAQ:TROV) inks an agreement with Lincoln Park Capital Fund, LLC for the purchase 382,166 common shares and five -year pre-funded warrants at $3.925 per share and warrant. Concurrently, Lincoln Park has also agreed to buy five-year warrants to purchase up to 382,166 common shares at $3.80 per share.
    • Combined net proceeds will be used for clinical development programs and working capital.
    • Shares are up 18% premarket on increased volume.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:02 AM | 1 Comment
  • SNAP

    Summit steps up to Snap sidelines

    • Summit Insights Group upgrades Snap (NYSE:SNAP) from Sell to Hold and doubles the price target from $5 to $10, an 11% downside.
    • Yesterday, Snap announced new content initiatives including a gaming platform.
    • Snap shares are up 2.6% pre-market to $11.57.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:51 AM | 15 Comments
  • MCD

    Telsey sees McDonald's topping $200

    • Telsey Advisory Group cites strong operating momentum at McDonald's (NYSE:MCD) in boosting its price target on the restaurant stock to $210.
    • Telsey's Robert Derrington is the latest Wall Street analyst to point to McDonald's CEO Steve Easterbrook's menu, marketing and tech initiatives as catalysts. Important to note, Telsey is confident that McDonald's can ride out economic ups and downs.
    • McDonald's is expected to post Q1 earnings in about three weeks.
    • MCD +0.18% premarket to $190.16. The 52-week high for shares is $190.88.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:41 AM | 18 Comments
  • TROV

    Trovagene up 16% premarket on positive onvansertib data

    • Nano cap Trovagene (NASDAQ:TROV) is up 16% premarket on light volume in reaction to updated results from its ongoing open-label Phase 1b/2 clinical trial evaluating onvansertib, combined with standard-of-care chemo, in patients with acute myeloid leukemia (AML).
    • The company says the best results have been observed in the onvansertib + decitabine arm where 50% (n=3/6) of evaluable patients receiving the two highest doses to date achieved complete responses.
    • According to ClinicalTrials.gov, the estimated primary completion date is January 2020.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:30 AM
  • GBX

    Greenbrier +5% after positive outlook

    • Greenbrier (NYSE:GBX) shoots higher in early trading after topping Q4 revenue estimates and disclosing that orders for 3.8K diversified railcars were received during the quarter ($450M value).
    • Looking ahead, Greenbrier expects full-year revenue to exceed $3.0B vs. $3.1B consensus and EPS of $3.60 to $3.80 vs. $3.61 consensus.
    • CEO outlook: "Over the balance of FY19, Greenbrier's financial performance and profitability will significantly improve compared to H1 of FY19. As a result, revenue and delivery estimates for FY19 are unchanged and we have updated EPS guidance today to reflect the impact of the unique operating challenges in the fiscal Q2. Greenbrier's backlog of 26,000 units valued at $2.7B will produce sustained railcar deliveries through FY19 and provides good visibility into FY20."
    • Shares of GBX are up 5.07% to $35.00 vs. a 52-week trading range of $31.81 to $64.87.
    • Previously: Greenbrier EPS in-line, beats on revenue (April 5)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:28 AM | 7 Comments
  • STZ

    Deutsche Bank to the sidelines on Constellation Brands

    • Deutsche Bank drops Constellation Brands (NYSE:STZ) to a Hold rating from Buy after taking in yesterday's 6.5% rally.
    • DB sees the risk/reward profile on Constellation as balanced at the new share price level.
    • The firm's price target of $194 gives Constellation just a little bit of room to run higher. In premarket trading, STZ is down 1.25% to $189.05.
    • Previously: Constellation Brands +4% after strong depletion performance (April 4)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:15 AM | 14 Comments

    • Celgene (NASDAQ:CELG) downgraded to Neutral with a $100 (6% upside) price target at Cantor Fitzgerald. Shares down a fraction premarket.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:59 AM | 1 Comment
  • BBBY

    Bed Bath & Beyond +2% after Morgan Stanley lift

    • Morgan Stanley upgrades Bed Bath & Beyond (NASDAQ:BBBY) to an Equal-weight rating from Underweight and increases its price target on the retailer to $20 from $13.
    • The MS analyst team thinks a rally could be sparked if BBBY activists are successful in bringing in a new board and CEO at the company.
    • Shares of BBBY are up 2.27% in premarket trading to $17.99.
    • Previously: Bed Bath & Beyond +16% with activists gearing up (March 26)
     
     
     
     
    | 7:41 AM | 54 Comments
  • SYRS

    Syros down 25% on pricing equity offerings

    • Syros Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:SYRS) has priced its public offerings of (i) 8,667,333 common shares and Class A warrants to purchase up to 1,951,844 common shares, at $7.50 per common share and warrant and (ii) 666 shares of Series A convertible preferred stock, convertible into 666,000 common shares and Class A warrants to purchase up to 166,500 common shares, at a combined price of $7,500 per Series A share and Class A warrant.
    • Each Class A warrant will have an exercise price of $8.625 per share and will expire 3.5 years from the date of issuance.
    • The gross proceeds are expected to be ~$70M.

  • ACB

    Aurora Cannabis successful in German cannabis tender

    • Aurora Cannabis (NYSE:ACB) has been selected by the German Bundesinstitut für Arzneimittel und Medizinprodukte BfArM as one of three winners in the public tender to cultivate and distribute medical cannabis in Germany.
    • The contract will be formalized on April 17.
    • The Company was awarded the maximum number of 5 of the 13 lots over a period of four years with a minimum total supply of 4000 kg.
    • The cannabis produced will be sold to the German government and supplied to wholesalers for distribution to pharmacies.
    • Shares are up 3% premarket.
    • Update: On April 18, the company announced that the contract was finalized.

    Intel downgraded on semi data, AMD pressure

    • Wells Fargo downgrades Intel (NASDAQ:INTC) from Outperform to Market Perform but increases the target from $55 to $60.
    • The firm cites weak YTD semi data, challenging comps, potential sentiment weakening on growing evidence of AMD share gains, and the negative impact of rising depreciation costs on gross margins and valuations.
